name: DTLA Community Hack Night at Nordstrom Rack/HauteLook (RSVP: tinyurl.com/NRHL17)
description:
Join us for our first DTLA community hack night hosted by Nordstromrack.com|Hautlook! Meet other developers, collaborate on projects, learn and teach with new friends, or just hang out and have fun! Everyone is invited, whether you're completely new to coding or you're a seasoned developer.

IMPORTANT: You must RSVP here to attend: tinyurl.com/NRHL17

https://img.evbuc.com/https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.evbuc.com%2Fimages%2F36936222%2F231663274328%2F1%2Foriginal.jpg?w=800&rect=10%2C0%2C978%2C489&s=53716711081e2e9376a210b27e77aabd

Our community hack night is all about sparking collaboration and mentorship between experienced developers and beginners from diverse backgrounds!


Agenda:

• 7pm: Food, drinks, mixing and mingling

• 7:30pm: Community announcements (open to anyone to share cool stuff!)

• 7:40pm: Hack all the things! Work on projects, learn new skills, have fun :)

• 9pm: Wrap up

What to bring:

Your computer, your appetite, and your curiosity!

Security:

Only those that have RSVPed via Eventbrite at tinyurl.com/NRHL17 will be allowed into the building. Please bring proof of identification (driver's licence, passport, etc). When you enter, you will check your name with the security guard downstairs who will then direct you to our meeting space..

If you plan on attending, please familiarize yourself with our Event Code of Conduct.


Parking / directions:

We highly recommend taking public transportation! The 7th Street/Metro Center station is literally across the street!

If you’re driving, there are several paid parking lots nearby. See this parking map for the best options:
https://www.parkme.com/map?lat=34.0482805&lng=-118.2589431&zoom=18&entryTime=7:00pm&duration=180&sort=price

*** Bring a valid photo ID! When you arrive at the front desk, check in with the security guard, who will then direct you to our meeting space.

A big thanks to Nordstromrack.com|Hautelook for hosting us!

Like our hack night? Interested in working with NRHL? Check out https://www.hautecode.io/

HauteLook is the leader in online, off-price retail and is the largest e-commerce shop in Los Angeles. With over 18 million members and billions of page views a year, we're constantly taking on challenges in search, payments, fraud prevention, and logistics — all through a customer-obsessed lens. Located in Downtown LA, we’re a rapidly growing group at the intersection of fashion and technology.
how_to_find_us: IMPORTANT: You must RSVP here to attend: tinyurl.com/NRHL17 and bring a valid photo ID! Check in with the security guard, who will then direct you to our meeting space.

name: November Mentorship Night and Coding Office Hours at Second Spectrum
description:
Want to learn to code, but not sure where to start? Interested in getting advice from tech industry professionals or some hands-on help with a coding problem? Join us for a special mentoring night and office hours event hosted by Second Spectrum!

Agenda:

7:00pm: Networking with some quick ice breaker games

7:30pm: Mentors will introduce themselves

7:30pm: Break up into small groups to chat with mentors -- and if you brought your laptop, mentors will help you with your coding questions too!

9:00pm: Wrap up


Everyone is welcome to attend, but please honor your RSVP. Our hosts, our volunteer mentors, our sponsors and our organizers donate considerable time and money to make our events happen. Please be respectful of everyone's time, energy, and money and make every effort to attend if you've indicated that you'll be there.


Mentors:

Already working in tech? Want to be a mentor and help answer questions and guide students? Sign up on our volunteer form here:
https://goo.gl/forms/45XOn5lXEA6qwCzw1


Sponsor and Host:

Big thanks to Second Spectrum for sponsoring us!

Second Spectrum builds tools using machine learning and computer vision to revolutionize sports through intelligence. They're the official optical tracking provider for the NBA, in addition to working with the EPL, MLS, NFL, NCAA, NHL, and MLB! They now have over 75 employees across 3 international offices, including their LA office where we'll be meeting.

Parking:

Directions and parking info to be posted here soon!

Everyone is welcome to attend our classes and events - we are women-inclusive, not women-exclusive. All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct.
how_to_find_us: (Directions and parking info to be updated on this page soon!)

name: Introduction to Command Line: The Most Powerful Way to Control Your Computer
description:
The command line is more than just a relic from '80s hacker movies; it's still the most powerful way to control your computer, not just for programming but for all sorts of tasks! Join us for this 2 hour workshop taught by Esther Lee, Senior Software Development Lead at Hulu, where we'll get you started on your journey towards computer wizardry!

Also, please come hungry! Hulu is sponsoring snacks for us! :)

What You'll Learn

This class will give you a quick, interactive tour of the basic command line commands, including how to create, read, edit, move and copy files and folders; how to use built-in help documentation; how to quickly search within and across files matching any kind of metadata; and how to redirect command line output like a pro.


*** This class is also a prerequisite for a number of future Girl Develop It classes, like our upcoming Intro to Ruby class, Python, Git/GitHub and more!

Prerequisites

This class is for absolute beginners with no experience in programming languages. If you've never coded before, then this is a great class for you!

What to bring

Please bring a laptop* and charger to class. Power outlets and wifi will be provided. You may also wish to bring a notepad and pen/pencil for taking notes.

* Request to borrow a laptop: No laptop? We have a limited number of laptops we can loan to students during class. Please fill out our Laptop Request form to let us know you need to borrow one!

Questions?

We're here to help! If you have any questions or anything you'd like to discuss before signing up for the class, please contact us at losangeles [at] girldevelopit dot com.

No Refunds 

If you can no longer attend the class you signed up and paid for, your payment will be donated to the local chapter scholarship fund. You can help another woman in need!

Other Disclaimers

Our program and curriculum are geared toward adults over the age of 18. At this time we do not accept minors as students in our courses and workshops.

If you have any accessibility issues we should know about, please email us at losangeles [at] girldevelopit dot com. We want to make sure everyone can participate!

Our events are women-inclusive, not women-exclusive. Anyone over the age of 18 is welcome to attend our events and classes. All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct. 

Volunteer as a Teacher Assistant

If you're already experienced with the command line, you can earn free classes by participating as a Teaching Assistant. Every hour you spend volunteering as a TA earns you a free hour of class time! Get more details and sign up to be a TA by filling out this form: https://goo.gl/forms/R8yIjbvQBZoFDAnJ2

Parking

There is metered street parking nearby, which is the best option here! There is a parking garage underneath the building, but parking tickets will not be validated and it's on the pricey side.

About the teacher

Esther Lee is Senior Software Development Lead at Hulu, and very excited to be a new Girl Develop It teacher to share her knowledge and experiences with aspiring developers!


Sponsor

Big thanks to Hulu hosting our class at their office and providing pizza and refreshments!

As always, anyone is welcome to attend our classes and events - we are women-inclusive, not women-exclusive. All attendees are expected to abide by our Girl Develop It Code of Conduct.
how_to_find_us: Meet us on the 2nd floor of the building (2500 Broadway) When you exit the elevator, our conference room is right there!

name: Introduction to Ruby for Complete Beginners (Two day weekend class)
description:
Join us for this two-day workshop introducing Ruby, a programming language that's popular for web development with the Ruby on Rails framework, used by companies like Hulu, Airbnb, and Indiegogo! 

This class will meet for two 4-hour sessions, Saturday Nov 18th and Sunday Nov 19th, and both sessions are covered for the $120 class fee. 

Big thanks to Fender Musical Instruments (yes, that Fender!) for sponsoring us at their beautiful Hollywood office and providing snacks! (Fender has a women's group with female programmers, UX/UI designers, product managers and more, and they want to give back to the community!)

What You'll Learn

• Basics of the command line and why we use it 

• Strings, arrays, variables, objects, loops, files 

• Object-oriented concepts like methods, instances, and classes

• How to run your Ruby code interactively (irb) or from a file

• Writing command line programs to run on your own computer

We will be getting your machines set up on the first class, so please be sure to attend. We will not be taking time in the following classes to set up your machines.

Schedule:

• Class 1: Saturday, November 18th, 12pm - 4pm

• Class 2: Sunday, November 19th, 12pm - 4pm

*** Both classes are covered for the $120 class fee. Please only RSVP if you can attend both sessions.

Prerequisites 

• This class is open to complete beginner with no prior coding experience! :)


• Knowledge of HTML/CSS is helpful but not required. We highly recommend first taking our Intro to HTML/CSS class if you're new to HTML and CSS.

What to Bring 


Please bring a laptop (or borrow one, see below!)* and charger to class. Power outlets and wifi will be provided. You may also wish to bring a notepad and pen/pencil for taking notes.

We'll be using a modern web browser and a text editor in class. If you don't already have these installed, please install them before you come to class.

For web browsers, we recommend Mozilla Firefox or Google Chrome. For a text editor, we recommend Sublime Text 3. Note that you do not have to purchase Sublime Text 3. If you download the free evaluation version that will be good enough for class.

* Request to borrow a laptop: No laptop? We have a limited number of laptops we can loan to students during class. Please fill out our Laptop Request form to let us know you need to borrow one!

Questions? 


We're here to help! If you have additional questions or would like to talk further before signing up for a class, please contact us at losangeles [at] girldevelopit dot com. 

About Our Teacher: Laura Kinson

Currently a software engineer at Fender, Laura Kinson is a self-taught developer proficient in JavaScript and Ruby. By night, she's also a yoga instructor! She has also worked in social media and digital outreach on behalf of entertainment brands, planning large-scale events and managing media relations.

No Refunds


If you can no longer attend the class you signed up and paid for, your payment will be donated to the local chapter scholarship fund. You can help another woman in need!

Other Disclaimers

Our program and curriculum are geared toward adults over the age of 18. At this time we do not accept minors as students in our courses and workshops.

If you have any accessibility issues we should know about, please email us at losangeles [at] girldevelopit dot com. We want to make sure everyone can participate!

Our events are women-inclusive, not women-exclusive. Anyone over the age of 18 is welcome to attend our events and classes. All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct. 


Volunteer as a Teacher Assistant

If you're already familiar with Git and GitHub, you can earn free classes by participating as a Teaching Assistant. Every hour you spend volunteering as a TA earns you a free hour of class time! Get more details and sign up to be a TA by filling out this form: https://goo.gl/forms/R8yIjbvQBZoFDAnJ2


Directions / Transportation

Fender is located within Columbia Square on Sunset & Gower.

It's also right off the Hollywood / Vine Metro stop! And remember, if you don't live near a Metro stop, you can always park your car at Metro's Park & Ride lots and then take the train to Hollywood.

Parking and Validation

There are two entrances to the garage, one on Gower and one on El Centro. Please self park and take the stairs or elevators up to the 1st floor.

*** We will email you before the class to give you contact info, in case you have trouble finding us.

Our Sponsor:

Big thanks to Fender Musical Instrumentsfor sponsoring us at their beautiful Hollywood office and providing snacks!

Fender has a women's group with female programmers, UX/UI designers, product managers and more, and they want to help the larger women in tech community!

name: Two-Hour Intro to JavaScript for Complete Beginners (Start building web apps!)
description:
Join us for our short workshop introducing JavaScript for total beginners! This is a two-hour preview class to give you a taste of web development and help you decide if you want to go further with JavaScript programming. :)

What You'll Learn

JavaScript is one of the most in-demand skills in the tech industry. It can be thought of as an extension to HTML which allows developers to incorporate more functionality into their web pages (such as an expandable menu or animated slideshow). 

Many programming courses end up glossing over some of the tricky words -- 'variable', 'object', 'method' -- this course is especially designed for beginners new to programming concepts, so you'll learn to program with JavaScript. If those words are confusing to you now, no worries! You're exactly who we want to teach.

In this class, we will be covering basic programming fundamentals and how to make web pages interactive by combining JavaScript with HTML. Students will exit this class with a good grasp of basic programming principles and the knowledge of how to manipulate HTML elements.

Prerequisites 

You should be comfortable with the basics of HTML and CSS -- we highly recommend taking one of our Intro to HTML/CSS classes first!

Java versus JavaScript

It's super confusing, but there are two separate programming languages called Java and JavaScript. Even more confusing? They really have nothing to do with one another. How do you figure out which one you want to learn? Here's a quick and simple overview:

Java is a back-end programming language most often used to create large, enterprise-level applications. It can be used to create websites, but can also be used to create stand-alone software.

JavaScript is a front-end programming language that's most often used to create interactivity in websites: drop-down menus, slide shows, tabs, accordions, ajax, games, etc.

Sure, it's a lot more complicated than that, but at a high level that should help you figure out which one you're looking for. Any questions? Hit us up at losangeles [at] girldevelopit.com and we'll gladly help you get it all sorted out.

What to Bring 


Please bring a laptop (or borrow one, see below!)* and charger to class. Power outlets and wifi will be provided. You may also wish to bring a notepad and pen/pencil for taking notes.

We'll be using a modern web browser and a text editor in class. If you don't already have these installed, please install them before you come to class.

For web browsers, we recommend Mozilla Firefox or Google Chrome. For a text editor, we recommend Sublime Text 3. Note that you do not have to purchase Sublime Text 3. If you download the free evaluation version that will be good enough for class.

* Request to borrow a laptop: No laptop? We have a limited number of laptops we can loan to students during class. Please fill out our Laptop Request form to let us know you need to borrow one!

Questions? 


We're here to help! If you have additional questions or would like to talk further before signing up for a class, please contact us at losangeles [at] girldevelopit dot com. 

About Our Teacher: Natalie MacLees

Natalie MacLees is a front-end web developer and UI designer and is founder + principal of the interactive agency, Purple Pen Productions. She's been coding and building websites since 1996. She is the author of jQuery for Designers, now in its second edition. She's also the co-founder of the Los Angeles chapter of Girl Develop It, bringing affordable and accessible coding classes to the community. She makes her online home at nataliemac.com. 


No Refunds


If you can no longer attend the class you signed up and paid for, your payment will be donated to the local chapter scholarship fund. You can help another woman in need!

Other Disclaimers

Our program and curriculum are geared toward adults over the age of 18. At this time we do not accept minors as students in our courses and workshops.

If you have any accessibility issues we should know about, please email us at losangeles [at] girldevelopit dot com. We want to make sure everyone can participate!

Our events are women-inclusive, not women-exclusive. Anyone over the age of 18 is welcome to attend our events and classes. All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct.

Volunteer as a Teacher Assistant

If you're already familiar with JavaScript, you can earn free classes by participating as a Teaching Assistant. Every hour you spend volunteering as a TA earns you a free hour of class time! Get more details and sign up to be a TA by filling out this form: https://goo.gl/forms/R8yIjbvQBZoFDAnJ2


Directions / Parking / Public Transit

We highly recommend taking public transportation, since our venue is right next to the Metro stop! And remember, if you don't live near a Metro stop, you can park your car at Metro's Park & Ride lots and then take the train downtown.

If you prefer to drive, there are several paid parking lots a short walk away; see this parking map for suggestions:

</a><a href="http://www.parkme.com/widget/?&lat=34.0493889&lng=-118.258664&zoom=18&entryTime=6:30pm&duration=180&sort=price">http://www.parkme.com/widget/?&lat=34.0493889&lng=-118.258664&zoom=18&entryTime=6:30pm&duration=180&sort=price

Sponsor: Cross Campus Downtown LA

A big thanks to Cross Campus coworking space for hosting our class!

Cross Campus Downtown LA is offering Girl Develop It one free month of coworking membership. See below for details.

Your complimentary membership will give you access to the entire 2nd floor, Monday-Friday from 9am-6pm for one month at our DTLA location. Upon your arrival you will get a complimentary membership card. Keep you card on you as you are required to show it every time you come in. In addition to workspace you will have access to our rejuvenation room, showers, member only happy hours and lunches.

To take advantage, send an email to [masked] and mention Girl Develop It LA!

name: Introduction to React.js
description:
Join us for a hands-on intro to React, a popular front-end library developed by Facebook and used by companies like Netflix, Flipboard, and Khan Academy!

What You'll Learn

This workshop will introduce you to the basic concepts you need to understand and work with React:

• What is React and why use it? 
• Working with components and the component lifecycle 
• JSX syntax and features
• Props and state 
• The virtual DOM

Prerequisites 

• You should be experienced with the basics of HTML and CSS -- we highly recommend taking our Intro to HTML/CSS class first, which is happening on Saturday/Sunday October 7th and October 8th.

• You should also be very comfortable with the basics of programming in JavaScript -- we highly recommend first taking our Intro to JavaScript class on Saturdays October 14th and October 21st.

• You might also find it helpful to review a video of Natalie's talk with her business partner, Nathan, called "Before you React", which covers some of the basics of JavaScript that you should brush up on and be familiar with. Video is here and slides are here.

What to Bring 


Please bring a laptop (or borrow one, see below!)* and charger to class. Power outlets and wifi will be provided. You may also wish to bring a notepad and pen/pencil for taking notes.

We'll be using be using Google Chrome in class and we'll be using the Chrome ReactJS extension. If you don't already have Chrome and the ReactJS extension installed, please install them before you come to class!


For a text editor, we recommend Sublime Text 3. Note that you do not have to purchase Sublime Text 3. If you download the free evaluation version that will be good enough for class.


* Request to borrow a laptop: No laptop? We have a limited number of laptops we can loan to students during class. Please fill out our Laptop Request form to let us know you need to borrow one!

Questions? 


We're here to help! If you have additional questions or would like to talk further before signing up for a class, please contact us at losangeles [at] girldevelopit dot com. 

About Our Teacher: Natalie MacLees

Natalie MacLees is a front-end web developer and UI designer and is founder + principal of the interactive agency, Purple Pen Productions. She's been coding and building websites since 1996. She is the author of jQuery for Designers, now in its second edition. She's also the co-founder of the Los Angeles chapter of Girl Develop It, bringing affordable and accessible coding classes to the community. She makes her online home at nataliemac.com. 


No Refunds


If you can no longer attend the class you signed up and paid for, your payment will be donated to the local chapter scholarship fund. You can help another woman in need!

Other Disclaimers

Our program and curriculum are geared toward adults over the age of 18. At this time we do not accept minors as students in our courses and workshops.

If you have any accessibility issues we should know about, please email us at losangeles [at] girldevelopit dot com. We want to make sure everyone can participate!

Our events are women-inclusive, not women-exclusive. Anyone over the age of 18 is welcome to attend our events and classes. All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct.

Volunteer as a Teacher Assistant

If you're already familiar with the basics of React, you can earn free classes by participating as a Teaching Assistant. Every hour you spend volunteering as a TA earns you a free hour of class time! Get more details and sign up to be a TA by filling out this form: https://goo.gl/forms/R8yIjbvQBZoFDAnJ2

We highly recommend taking public transportation, since our venue is right next to the Metro stop! And remember, if you don't live near a Metro stop, you can park your car at Metro's Park & Ride lots and then take the train downtown.
